comments:
Just restarting a workspace, when files are out-of-sync, is painfully slow.  In 
this case, some of the plugins are auto-refreshing files during the restoration 
of state; however, this kicks off a chain of events that results in CVS logging 
a stack trace, an example of which is below.  But this actually occurs whenever 
a file is refreshed or modified in isolation, without refreshing the entire 
workspace.

org.eclipse.core.internal.resources.ResourceException: Resource is out of sync 
with the file system: /foo/bar/CVS/Entries.
	at 
org.eclipse.core.internal.localstore.FileSystemResourceManager.read(FileSystemRe
sourceManager.java:318)
	at org.eclipse.core.internal.resources.File.getContents(File.java:203)
	at org.eclipse.core.internal.resources.File.getContents(File.java:193)

.java:313)

urceSync(EclipsePhantomSynchronizer.java:128)

esource.java:178)

urce(AddDeleteMoveListener.java:192)

	at

*** This bug has been marked as a duplicate of 36146 ***
